footer.description: Platform for preserving, developing and promoting the rich cultural heritage of the Karakalpak people

sovereignty.historicEventText: December 14, 1990 became the most important event in the history of Karakalpakstan. 186 deputies of the Supreme Council of Karakalpakstan unanimously adopted the Declaration on State Sovereignty.
sovereignty.tripartiteText: At this historic meeting, USSR Prime Minister V.S. Pavlov officially recognized the Declaration on State Sovereignty of Karakalpakstan. This was the first official recognition at the international level.
sovereignty.photo1Caption: In the photo (from left): President of Uzbek SSR I.A. Karimov, Chairman of the Supreme Council of Karakalpakstan Dauletbay Shamshetov and USSR Prime Minister V.S. Pavlov
sovereignty.photo2Caption: Official decision signed by Chairman of the Supreme Council of Karakalpakstan T.Eshimbetov - December 14, 1990
sovereignty.photo3Caption: Declaration published in 'Erkin Karakalpakstan' newspaper on December 20, 1990
sovereignty.currentStatusText: According to Article 85 of the Constitution of Uzbekistan, Karakalpakstan is still considered a 'Sovereign Republic' to this day.
sovereignty.right1: Right to have its own constitution
sovereignty.right3: Right to adopt its own legislation
sovereignty.whatHappenedText: In July 2022, the government of Uzbekistan attempted to remove Karakalpakstan's status as a 'Sovereign' republic. The people protested against this.
sovereignty.reaction1: Thousands of people took to the streets in Nukus and other cities
sovereignty.reaction3: 21 people died, more than 500 people were detained
sovereignty.mirziyoyevResponse: Response of President Mirziyoyev of Uzbekistan
sovereignty.mirziyoyevText: The President of Uzbekistan stated at a meeting of the Jokargy Kenes in Nukus that no changes would be made to Karakalpakstan's sovereign status. This demonstrated the importance of Karakalpakstan's sovereignty rights.
sovereignty.videoQuote: President in Nukus: 'No changes will be made to Karakalpakstan's sovereign status'
sovereignty.warningText: Uzbekistan's special services (SGB) are attempting to distort history by preparing fake documents about Karakalpakstan and distributing them on the internet.
sovereignty.unCharterText: Equal rights and self-determination of all peoples
sovereignty.civilPact: International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights - Article 1
sovereignty.civilPactText: All peoples have the right to self-determination
sovereignty.intlPracticeText: Karakalpakstan's sovereign status is consistent with international experience such as the Basque Country in Spain or the Åland Islands in Finland.
sovereignty.photoNote: Note: Photos will be added later.

declaration.fullText:
Supreme Council of the Karakalpak Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic:

To determine the fate of a multinational people, assuming historical significance, asserting its independence, respecting the sovereignty of all peoples of the USSR, relying on the exclusive right of all peoples to self-determination, on the basis of all that relates to the Karakalpak Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic, reviewing all previously adopted provisions and laws that contradict the current relations between the USSR, The Uzbek SSR and the Karakalpak ASSR, having informed the Supreme Soviet of the Uzbek SSR, adopted this present resolution...
